isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB DOOR GLASS

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Glass with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 39
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: For vehicle equipped with electric door window, lower cab door glass (Item 1) to the bottom of cab door (Item 2) before disconnecting electric window switch panel (Item 3) during cab door trim panel (Item 4) removal.

Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For removing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Working through cab door access opening (Item 5), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 6), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 7) and pivot ball (Item 8) from cab door window slide block (Item 9) in cab door window slide rail (Item 10), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 42 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cab door glass seal and run channel by first pulling left side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) from cab door (Item 2). Then pull the top of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 3) down from the cab door, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 42. Cab Door Glass Seal and Run Channel

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. LEFT SIDE OF CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND RUN CHANNEL
3. TOP OF CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND RUN CHANNEL

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Pull right side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) from the cab door (Item 2), driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, if not damaged.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Cab Door Glass Seal and Run Channel

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. RIGHT SIDE OF CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND RUN CHANNEL

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 44 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Pull cab door glass seal and inner belt (Item 1) from inner lower flange of front cab door (Item 2). Also pull cab door glass seal and outer belt (Item 3) from outer lower flange of cab door, driver side shown. Lay them both out of the way and save for installation, if not damaged.
Lift cab door glass (Item 4) up to cab door glass opening of cab door (Item 2), driver side shown. Modular door hardware assembly removed for clarity.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Cab Door Glass Seal and Inner and Outer Belt

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND INNER BELT
3. CAB DOOR GLASS SEAL AND OUTER BELT

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 45 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: From outside cab door (Item 1), pull front cab door glass (Item 2) up and out of cab door glass opening (Item 3), driver side shown. Lay cab door glass out of the way and save for installation, if not damaged.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door glass.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Glass for Cab Door with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 41
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: For vehicle equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 1) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 2) and lower cab door glass (Item 3) to the bottom of cab door (Item 4), driver side shown.

Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. For cab door equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. For removing cab door vapor barrier, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Working through cab door access opening (Item 5), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 6), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 7) and pivot ball (Item 8) from cab door window slide block (Item 9) in cab door window slide rail (Item 10), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 42
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove cab door glass seal and run channel by first pulling left side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) from cab door (Item 2). Then pull the top of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 3) down from the cab door, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 43
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Pull right side of cab door glass seal and run channel (Item 1) from the cab door (Item 2), driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, if not damaged.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 44
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Pull cab door glass seal and inner belt (Item 1) from inner lower flange of front cab door (Item 2). Also pull cab door glass seal and outer belt (Item 3) from outer lower flange of cab door, driver side shown. Lay them both out of the way and save for installation, if not damaged.
Lift cab door glass (Item 4) up to cab door glass opening of cab door (Item 2), driver side shown. Modular door hardware assembly removed for clarity.

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 45
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: From outside cab door (Item 1), pull front cab door glass (Item 2) up and out of cab door glass opening (Item 3), driver side shown. Lay cab door glass out of the way and save for installation, if not damaged.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab door glass.
